33458862.review:
PLEASE NOTE: I actually have several hours of gameplay into this game but I usually play while steam is in offline mode (When im on road trips, at a friend place, etc.)

Hidden in Plain Sight is a party-style/friends-necessary type game. However, if you gather some friends, there is no other game like this one. I have played this game on Xbox 360 at friends houses for as long as its been out, and I can honestly say it was worth every penny and every minute. You will have an absolute blast playing this game. 10/10

Pros:
1) Amazing concept
2) Perfect execution of said concept
3) Doesnt require any type of high-end computer
4) Party style game that almost anyone can enjoy
5) Family-friendly
6) Ps4 controller was plugged in and automatically worked with no problem or 3rd party download.

Cons:
1) Must have friends to play
2) Must have a controller to play (Ps4 controller works and I believe xbox 360 controllers do, but I'm not sure about any others)

All in all I HIGHLY recommend this game for anyone and everyone who enjoys party style game. Once again - 10/10

(Please note I didnt put graphics in the cons section because there are clearly pictures showing exactly what the game looks like. Although I dont think good graphics would even have a place in this game)

33263350.review: Great game. Had lots of fun playing with a friend, and every mode was unique and entertaining. One of my favorite couch co-op games so far. I just can't wait to play it with more people, since I can only imagine how hectic and difficult things would get with 3-4 players. Only downside is that there's no online play and the developer has made it very clear that it will not be added, which is a real shame. I understand it wouldn't be as much fun as being in the same room, but I would have bought extra copies to play with friends and family online without hesitation.

33160744.review:
Note: This game (or more accurately, the library this game is built on) requires Windows Media Player to work. So, if you don't have WMP in your computer, the game won't work at all. That aside, I can't talk about how good the game is because I've not being able to play it. But it looks nice and it's cheap, so hey.

By the way, this was previously a negative review, but the developer send me a very nice email making me understand how things were. Pretty cool guy. Try talking to him if you have any problem, before giving negative reviews (sorry!).

30413953.review:
Hidden in Plain Sight n'est rien moins que la Rolls des Jeux multijoueurs en local et ceci pour plusieurs raisons :
La première, qui est aussi la moins méritoire, c'est que le genre est tellement sous représenté sur nos PC par rapport au total des jeux disponibles que c'en est une honte, il y a quelques jeux qui se joue à deux sur le même écran, mais à partir de 3 ou même 4 joueurs, à part les simulations de sport collectif, c'est le néant. Il suffit donc d'être un bon jeu dans cette catégorie pour être dans les tops du genre, mais HIPS à d'autres arguments à faire valoir :

1. Quatre jeux en un : HIPS, c'est quatre petits jeux basés sur un principe ingénieux de dissimulation de son avatar et de découverte de celui des autres, une sorte de grand cache cache virtuel ou l'on apprend à fondre son petit personnage au milieu de plusieurs dizaines d'autres gérés par l'IA du jeu et de 1 à 3 adversaires que rien ne distinguent de tous les autres si ce n'est leur comportement...

2. Simple et Casual : Des mécaniques simples et accessibles à tous immédiatement, y compris aux non-gamers, aux enfants et autres technophobes.

3. Rapide et rythmé : chaque partie dure entre 1 et 5 minutes grand max, on s'amuse et on rigole.

4. Fou rire et coup de pute garantie : comme dans tout bon multi local qui se respecte, ça chouine, ça gueule et ça se marre.

HIPS a aussi les défauts de ses qualités, c'est un jeu purement multijoueurs qui n'a absolument aucun intérêt en solo et ne révèle tout son potentiel qu'à quatre joueurs (même s'il reste amusant à trois et jouable à deux). 
Typiquement le jeu idéal pour se marrer avec des potes entre deux parts de pizza, HIPS est une pépite en son genre.

25626770.review:
Must-Have for every Couchlover. Though half of the modes are barely any fun, the other 3 make up a very fun experience.

You should play this game with some house rules, since the built-in systems do not support some mandatory stuff.

I recommend the game for the following:

Death Race: Extremely fun. Everyone is one of the about 20 characters on screen, the other being NPCs. You can only Press A to walk or Y to run and shoot with a crosshair on screen. First to finish wins, but if you are too obvious someone will shoot you and you are out.

Houserule: sadly, the game does not give you the ability to get an extra shot if you actually killed one of your friends. So just set shots to 4, only have everybody shooting once, except they get a player kill, which gives them another one. WAY better that way.

Thief Party: Fun overall. There are 2 Teams, thiefs and snipers. the thieves are one of the otherwise NPC characters on the field, about 20. There are coins, which give a sound once a thief walks over it and they disappear a random time after that. Snipers have a crosshair and 3 shots to kill the thieves. You should always play 2 rounds, switching teams on each. The thieves which collect more coins win. If the snipers waste all their shots, the thieves win automatically and a new set of round starts.

Assassins: Same as thief Party basically, but the assassins kill the NPCs instead of collecting coins. Same fun though and still quite different to play out.

The other gamemodes are quite awful though.

Nonetheless: MUST-HAVE. Extremely fun to play. Even if you are only playing this for 20 mins on a day with your friends on your couch, it is totally worth it every time.

25355980.review: This is my go-to party game. The modes Catch a Thief, Assassin, and especially Death Race are easy to explain and fun to play as a group. I would love to see new modes from the developer, but I can't complain - it's inexpensive and fun as is.

25349883.review:
2 pessoas = ...

5 pessoas = HAHAHAHA


A diversão é diretamente proporcional ao numero de pessoas que estão jogando.
obs.: Tenha no mínimo 3 controles (O jogo suporta até 4).

25074684.review:
Шикарная, просто шикарная игра для локального мультиплеера. Зовите своих друзей в гости и садитесь играть в эту игру, скучно не будет! Сразитесь со своими друзьями в игре в имитацию, развивающую хитрость и внимательность, в пяти режимах игры, каждый из которых по своему хорош.   По сути в каждом режиме вашей задачей является вычислить игрока, который сидит рядом с вами и прикидывается что он бот. Игра наполнена большим количеством ботов, которые ведут себя по разному, а следовательно задача не так проста как кажется на первый взгляд. 
Вечеринка ниндзя: на карте все выглядят исключительно как ниндзя. Для победы либо коснитесь всех 5 статуй, либо устраните всех конкурентов. Вдвоем скучно, рекомендуется 3-4 человека.
Поймай воришку: снайперы против воров. По карте разбросаны монетки. Ворам ясное дело нужно их украсть. Снайперам же нужно вычислить и застрелить их. Вся соль в том, что действует "туман войны" и исчезновение монетки обнаруживается лишь когда снайперы наводятся на нее своим прицелом.
Рыцари против ниндзя: Рыцари охраняют 3 вип-персоны, ниндзя должны их убить. Опять же таки режим на 3-4 человека.
Смертельная гонка: Здесь вы можете либо стоять, либо идти вперед, либо бежать вперед. Пути назад, влево или право нет. Всего лишь надо достигнуть финишной линии... И не схлопотать пулю соперника.
Ассасин-убийца: пожалуй самый интересный режим, где в толпе гуляет маньяк-массовый убийца. Его цель простая - всадить заточку промеж ребер всем и каждому, и самому остаться живым. Противником убийцы вновь выступит снайпер, у которых вновь действует "туман войны" - убитый бот будет ходить до тех пор, пока не попадет в зону прицела снайпера.
Непередаваемые ощущения, когда на тебя наводится снайпер и бок пихает локоть "...это ты, да? ты? Я знаю что это ты... но я драгоценную пулю на тебя тратить не буду... пока что)))" Всем советую брать, своих денег стоит даже без скидок.

Важно! Для игры необходимы джойстики! Причем 360ые. Однако "проблема" джойстиков решается крайне просто - в интернете есть бесплатный эмулятор геймпада х360 для клавиатуры. Сами выбираете какие клавишы будут отвечать какой функции джойстика. А также есть эмулятор 360ого для других геймпадов и джойстиков. Называется "x360ce", тоже бесплатный. Выбирается устройство, настраиваете все клавишы, копируете в папку с игрой - профит! Получайте удовольствие от игры без 360ого геймпада!

Hidden in plain sight is a game that, if played with your friends, its guaranteed to make you sweat in anxiety (if you aren't a psycopath, of course).
Its cheap, its awesome, and its worth it, but be alert about 2 things with this game:

This game only has local multiplayer
This game requires a microsoft original controller (or an emulator for that).

If you fulfill this 2 requirements, then you can have yourself a great time with friends, othewise you should avoid it.

24817525.review:
Been a long time fan of this game, first on the Xbox 360 and now on the PC.
It's such a simple premise and leads to just a huge amount of fun for anyone from families to drunken uni groups.
Despite being just 5 simple mini games it's still fun after hours of playing, it’s addictive but in the fun kind of social competitive way that makes you wanna just try one more go.
The only downer is you need to have 3 or 4 players to really get into it, and I wish this version supported more players (which I think Xbox One controllers support).
But out of the scout groups, families (ages 10-60) and uni mates I've never had any group not enjoy this game... Hopefully some have also bought it. :)
(9 out of 10)

Might get slightly repetitive, since there is about 5 gamemodes only. Definitely worth the 6€ though!

23757850.review:
We live in a time where local multiplayer games are slowly dying out. They are being replaced by massive companies pushing unfinished AAA titles to your face faster than you can buy them. Hidden in Plain Sight is one of those gems that truly remind us of the golden times before the dark reign of EA, Ubisoft, etc. (And when all gamers were not introvert teenagers)



This game does not offer much. But for that price I think it's more than worth it. This game basicly has 5 game modes each have their own twist but all of them have the same idea which is: find your enemies and don't let them find you. It's so simple even my non-gamer friends can play it and have a great time.

23392887.review:

18138607.review: Such a simplistic game, but absolutely a riot.  First, figure out which of the "NPCs" on the board is actually you.  Next, make sure nobody else does.  And finally, meet a goal.  Could be killing the other players, touching a series of statues, or running a race while the others have exactly one shot to shoot who they think is you.  Can only be played locally, 2 players, but it's tons of fun.  Highly recommend.  Just a matter of time before you see people making clones of this.  Such a simple premise, but such good gameplay.

18060820.review:
A "Local Multiplayer Only" Must Buy.

We've logged some time on this game, and feel it's a fun time filler. You can pick it up and play a few rounds of the mini-game of your choice and play for either a couple of minutes or for long durations.
The mini-games are different enough to be interesting, but similar enough that the gameplay controls don't require a lot of extra thought (when playing with casual gamers).

It's a good game to have if you have a couple of XBox 360 controllers and friends. Simple and entertaining. Watch a gameplay video on YouTube to see if the mini-games are up your alley.

17754165.review: Perfect party game, many laughs to be had.

17660676.review:
Played this game with four friends with controllers last night. [i]The concept behind this game is certainly cool, but core gameplay needs more work.[/i] While there are many game modes, the game boils down to some portion of friends are trying to blend in with the computer controlled characters, and the other friends are trying to pick the humans out. Usually picking them out is controlling a cross-hair and having only 3 bullets to do so. [b]The main problem is that picking out the humans is almost random - for most modes there is no easy mechanism to tell who your friends are.[/b] When we put this to the test with four friends last night, we got bored because of the randomness - it is surprisingly easy to act like a computer-driven character.

[b]Pros:[/b]
+There are different modes of gameplay that are fairly distinct
+Controller support is good, and there are great ways to 'swap' roles each round
+Its cheap

[b]Cons:[/b]
-The game modes and core design need to be worked out more, some way to make it more competitive
-Graphics look stock from some game-building program - there is no unifying theme (i.e. skeletons, ninjas, snowmen, and then hand-drawn images etc.)
-Local co-op only, although this would not be fun online

When it comes to local co-op, I'd steer away from this one.

17652054.review: Best party game ever, I was playing it on several trips without internet so that's why I have only 3 minutes played( justplayed 2 minutes longer because I needed 5 mins to post review lol). But me and my friends were laughing our asses off in this game. It is best to play it with friends that you know good and that want to have fun instead of just win every time. I can't imagine singleplayer but online multiplayer wouldn't hurt.

17550543.review:
Just had a bunch of people over for a couch-gaming session, and this was the hit of the evening!

The varied game modes really let you keep things fresh, and they're really different strategically from each other.

The only issue we had was that it took us a while to figure out that in thief mode and assasin mode, the coins don't disappear and people don't appear dead until the sniper scopes actually view the coin/victim.

One other thing we wished for was a 3v1-type team-swapper, so that we could always have 3 snipers and one thief, but have who is the thief change each round.

16584965.review:
Take on five different game modes in which you need to blend amongst the AI crowd to fulfil your goal.

-Punch out others blending amongst the crowd in 'Ninja' mode
-Snipe thieves in a crowded room
-Keep your cool and suss out your friends as you crawl your way to the finish line past snipers in 'Race' mode
-Defend the royal family and take out ninjas in 'Knights vs. Ninjas'
-Seek and snipe assassins in the aptly named 'Assassin' mode 


Wasn't expecting to have such a blast with this game, especially since it wasn't even on sale but took the leap and definitely do not regret it. It's got suspense, bluffing and tension in spades! There was many a moment that had me and my brothers choking with laughter.

Unfortunately for this day and age, It's **Local Multiplayer** only but quite possibly the best damn local game I've played in a while!

16509287.review:
I used to scour Steam for local co-op games that could provide a great party experience. This game takes the cake. Hidden in Plain Sight is the single best and most fun local co-op game I've ever played out of over 50 that I've bought and tried.

I've had a room full of people cursing at each other, laughing their asses off to tears, and jumping up and down, while at other times the whole room is silent in concentration and suspense, every set of eyes dead-focused on trying not to be caught by the others' - all caused by this wonderfully simple yet strategically genius video game.

GET IT!

15670667.review:
(We are playing Race. One character starts very obviously sprinting ahead.)
Me: Hah. What an idiot. I got 'im. (I move my crosshair to the "idiot", lining up the shot. No one else bothers to move their crosshairs, not wanting to waste their only rifle shot)
Me: I got him....I got him......I don't got him....! (The character crosses the finish line before I fire)...It was me.
Others: OHH, YOU FUCKING BASTARD!

Games like HIPS are signalpoints that local multiplayer is dead on consoles, and *more* than alive on PCs. This is a great concept that only works when played in a single room. The amount of double-tricking in some of the more straightforward gamemodes is really fun. I didn't enjoy some of the team-based, asymmetrical modes quite as much, but I'm sure they could become more interesting once people are aware of some of the strategies involved.

15503024.review: 최대 4명이서 즐길수있는 5가지의 미니게임이 있는게임입니다. 대부분 심리(눈치)게임이며 패드4개로 다같이 거실에앉아서 하면 쉽게 즐길 수 있고 많은 예능상황들이 나오는 게임입니다. 아이디어가 훌륭하고 게임성역시 상당히 좋으나 게임수가 적어 컨텐츠소모가 빠르다는점이 감점요인입니다. 하지만 가격대비 접대용으로는 최고인것 같습니다. 추천합니다!

14905501.review:
After 17 minutes together with a friend in the couch I came to the conclusion that the game is a [i]brilliant[/i] concept that is executed well enough to possibly be one of the most tension-nerve-and-panic-wrecking experiences I've had in my 25 years of digital gaming. It takes about 3 minutes to understand and is a game about pure psychological mindgames.

The ninja-mode comes especially recommended, as it possibly has the most tactical decisions involved.

Graphics are indie and remind me of the 16-bit pixelish era, controls simple and responsive - only played with pads - music uncanny.

If you ever want to play anything with one or more friends next to you and have a blast, there is no triple A-title that will come close to what this gem will deliver.

14078172.review:
Short version:  Buy this game if you have a) Multiple 360-compatible controllers in your home and b) people that want to play while sitting next to you.  You will not regret it.  If you don't have those requirements then there is no reason to buy this game.

Long version:
This game is a riot that's really easy to recommend to the right audience.  If you like playing games couch co-op with your kids or having people over for party games, it's WELL worth the $5.  Imagine being a character in a where's waldo picture, only all the other characters are moving around, and you have to assassinate as many of them as you can before snipers discover and kill you.  That's the general concept behind this game.

There are several game modes with different objectives and teams.  Some are more fun than others - death race looks the lamest but turned out to be the most fun for my group.  I played this game with three of my kids ages 10, 8, and 7 and they loved it.

This game could be a LOT better with more game modes or more polished gameplay.  It's not always clear who "won" in a particular round, for example.  But that didn't stop me and the family from enjoying the crap out of it.

14072250.review:

Ses nombreux modes de jeux permettent de varier un peu l'expérience mais chacun d'entre eux est équilibré. Rapidement vous deviendrez un expert en ruse et en coup bas.
Parfait.

11288172.review:
I may only have a small amount of time racked up on here, but rest assured I've sunk many hours into Hidden in Plain Sight on the Xbox 360 version, and man am I glad to see it here on Steam too. Hidden in Plain Sight is a collection of five minigames, all of which are best played with four players, right there at in the same room as you. They all insanely fun (Ninja Party is my favourite) and rely on you keeping your cool as others try to reveal and capture you, while at the same time, you're trying to capture everyone else. 

Ninja Party, for example, has 2-4 players all as identical ninjas, amongst 30 other identical ninjas. Each player must either be the last one standing by eliminating the other players, or by touching 5 statues scattered around the room, which play a sound each time they're touched. Do you run straight for all the statues, aiming for a quick win but putting yourself in danger of being noticed? Or do you wait for an unsuspecting player to set off the statue, and slay them from behind?

This is one of the most fun, if not THE most fun local multiplayer games I've ever played, hands down. This is what multiplayer gaming was about: having fun with REAL PEOPLE, before it all became about leaderboards and strangers from halfway across the world. People that you know; friends, family, whoever. Anyone can play this game, from your pro MLG 360 noscopers to your filthy pleb casuals.

And it's so refreshing to see local multiplayer games make a comeback, even if most of them are indie titles. Hidden in Plain Sight is a prime example of a simple and brilliant idea with simple and brilliant excecution. It doesn't fall prey to other indie game tropes such an annoyingly pretentious storyline or an obsession with "unique" and overused gimmicks.

Yeah, it might not look a treat, but the graphics really, really don't matter. Same goes for the sound, as most of the time you'll be yelling anyway. The gameplay is incredibly unique, tense, and just insanely fun. It's as simple as that. If you're looking for a local multiplayer game, then buy this. At $5 it's an absolute steal. I cannot recommend it enough.

4.5/5

11279783.review:
I've played this game on Ouya and then the PC version, and everytime it was increadibly easy to get people into playing it and it was a massive amount of fun as well.

Also, Steam version improves on earlier existing PC version. This has the same customization options as on other platforms now, which I feel is a must-have addition, since I sometimes feel the need to tweak the settings the way we want to play (for example, I occasionally feel that 3 sniper shots is way too much for Catch a Thief, or I want bots to run as well in Death Race). So even if you, like me, have the previously released PC version, I would definitely recommend picking it up.

11276835.review:
Déjà joué plein de fois sur Xbox 360

C'est un excellent party game, un concept très sympa, excelelentissime à 4. Le concept est simple : vous vous déplacez tous sur l'écran, mais vous vous ressemblez tous et rien ne vous indique qui vous êtes. Il faudra donc dans un premier temps se reconnaître sans se dévoiler aux autres, tout en trouvant qui est qui, car il y a également des NPCs qui se déplacent comme vous! 
Soit vous tuez les autres, sachant qu'en frappant vous vous révèlez forcément, il ne faut donc pas se tromper, ou alors toucher les 3 poteaux qui font un bruit chaque fois uqu'n joueur les touche... 
Il y a d'autres modes de jeu, mais globalement ça joue sur le fait d'être caché tout en étant visible à l'écran. A vous d'être plus malin.

Franchement de bonnes barres de rire entre potes. Par contre c'est local uniquement, pas de multi en ligne, pas de solo!

11275703.review:
The most fun local multiplayer game since sliced bread.  Easy to learn, fun to play and watch.  The perfect party game.

I've played this game on another platform mostly, but the gameplay on Steam is identical.

11159543.review:
-IMPORTANT NOTE-
This game is for local co-op only, if you don't got friends who have controllers probably not a good idea then to get this game there is no online multiplayer there is no LAN gameplay either. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4j8ZM8pgHds Despite those main flaws this game is highly entertaining and a great party game.
Maximum of four players can play at a time and it has various game modes to keep
things interesting. 
[url=www.gamers-haven.org]Gamers-Haven[/url]

39336407.review: This game is an amazing local multiplayer experience. It's very simply presented and the controls are easy, but behind the simple veneer lies almost infinite potential for deception..HiPS is similar to the board game "Are You a Werewolf" and other games of cunning; because the mechanics are stripped down and the rules are simple, the game plays out as a pure battle of wits. Truly a must-have for any couch multiplayer enthusiast (and very affordable!)

39228605.review: Game is a blast and hilarious. Its a shame it doesn't have a little more polish and depth because it is really unique and great fun with up to 4 players.

39166705.review: Hilarious party game with 4+ friends and a couple drinks. It's great because while four people can play at once, everyone can participate. It's worth the price.

38969322.review:
Perfect local multi-player game. Had us gasping, roaring in excitment, and laughing until the tears flowed. The modifiable options are perfect, allowing us to adjust for quirks in our group, without breaking the game. About my only complaint would be certain aspects need to be better documented, primarily the interaction between coins/murders and the sniper scope lights.

If you are ever in a situation where you can get four people round one computer (or one TV with a Steam Link in my case) then this game is a bargin even at full price. It's everything a party game should be.

38941062.review: Short and enjoyable party game with friends. I play it via the Steam Link on the couch with a bunch of Xbox controllers. Always funny and a great way to kill about an hour and a half with friends once a month.

38837639.review: Great couch game to play with friends.

39473168.review:
Simple mais terriblement fun.
Un genre de "1, 2, 3 soleil" amélioré où les parties et les crises de rires/nerfs s'enchaînent sans qu'on voit le temps passer.
Pas de online mais le développeur explique clairement les convictions qui l'ont poussé à ne pas proposer de jeu en ligne.

39469844.review: Its super cool that they added a battle royale mode after all this time. My favorite game of deception.
